trans-unit.note: condensed form of 'if there is a path to the right', as in: 'if path to the right, turn right'.

trans-unit.source: Congratulations! You have completed this level.
trans-unit.note: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the maze, inviting them to precede to the next level of difficulty.

trans-unit.source: There is a solution using only 3 blocks. Can you find it? Did you try the new option on the while block?
You could solve this level with fewer blocks. Can you find a solution with fewer blocks?
trans-unit.note: hint - 'block' refers to a child's stackable toys.

trans-unit.source: Use the function, remove 1 and jump hurdle, to make the farmer level out the mounds. Notice the difference between the given function in the current level and the function in the last level.
Move the farmer to the hole and make them fill it until it is even.

trans-unit.note: Congratulating the user on correctly answering the question.

trans-unit.source: Can you find a solution using only 4 blocks? Try using one of the green loop blocks.
Can you find a solution using 4 blocks? Try putting a loop inside of another loop. Remember, loop blocks are green.
trans-unit.note: hint - A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the enclosed actions until finish point is reached.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - Repeat the enclosed commands until the maze has been successfully completed (the end point reached).
brief title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Maze''' tutorial.

trans-unit.source: There is a solution using only 3 blocks. Can you find it? Did you using the repeat block?
trans-unit.note: hint - A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over.

trans-unit.source: Sorry, '%1' doesn't correspond with any saved Blockly file.
trans-unit.note: alert - A request to retrieve a stored program does not have a valid URL. %1 is the invalid portion of the URL. 'Blockly' is the name of the system. It should be left untranslated or it should be transliterated. See [[Translating:Blockly#Special_terms]].
Congratulating the user on correctly answering the question.
Yes indicates that this option is true and correct.
warning - Only one more block may be added. Do not alter the portions between pointy brackets (< and >), although you may move them within the phrase and replace 1 with one or more words.

trans-unit.source: Use the function block to make the farmer fill in all the holes.

trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes the user's program to be saved and for a URL to be provided for retrieving it. The word 'blocks' is as in children's toy blocks.
hint - 'block' refers to a child's stackable toys.
condensed form of 'if there is a no path to the left', as in: 'if no path to the left, turn left'.
button label - Pressing the button causes Pegman return to the start of the maze (but does not delete the user's program.)

trans-unit.source: Turns me left or right by 90 degrees.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.

verb - imperative or infinitive for a person turning his head and body one quarter rotation clockwise. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn left'. See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].
verb - imperative or infinitive for a person putting down a ball.
An abbreviation of the direction East
button label - Pressing the button runs the computer program the user has written.

trans-unit.source: Create a new function, remove 3, that removes 3 shovelfuls from a mound, and use it to help the farmer level out all the mounds.

trans-unit.note: button - Closes the dialog and stays on the current level
Congratulating the user on correctly answering the question.

trans-unit.source: On this level, you need to stack together all of the blocks in the white workspace.
trans-unit.note: alert - This is displayed if a user attempts to run a program composed of multiple stacks of blocks, letting them know they need to create a single stack.

trans-unit.source: Use the new functions, remove tower and fill tower, to level out the mounds and fill in the holes.

trans-unit.note: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person moving (walking) in the direction he/she is facing.

trans-unit.source: Help the farmer flatten the field so they can plant their crops. Move the farmer to the mound of dirt and remove it.
Create a new function, jump hurdle and remove 1, that helps the farmer jump the hurdle and remove 1 shovelful from a mound, and use it.

trans-unit.note: An abbreviation of the direction West

trans-unit.source: It's dark outside and now the farmer can't tell how large the mound is. This means one of the options on the while loop has been taken away. Tell the farmer how many shovelfuls of dirt to remove.

trans-unit.note: verb - imperative or infinitive to repeat the following commands. The phrase is followed by the symbol denoting the end of the maze.

trans-unit.source: Define a new function that fills a hole which needs 7 shovelfuls to make the farmer fill in all the holes.

trans-unit.note: Indicates the lack of any balls, as in 'she took the last ball, there are now no balls present'

trans-unit.source: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do some actions.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.
No indicates that this option is false and incorrect.

trans-unit.source: Use only the blocks you need to get to complete the level.
trans-unit.note: hint - 'block' refers to a child's stackable toys.

tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.

trans-unit.source: Make the farmer remove all the mounds, using as few blocks as possible.

trans-unit.note: Place a tower on the ground
verb - imperative or infinitive to repeat the following commands. The phrase is followed by the symbol denoting the end of the maze.
An abbreviation of the direction North

trans-unit.source: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
trans-unit.note: tracking is suggesting to the user that they should follow each instruction and follow how that will affect the movement. A 'program' is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.
verb - imperative or infinitive for a person picking up a ball.
Place a tower up off the ground
tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes a program in the JavaScript computer language to be displayed, based on the program created by the user.

trans-unit.source: Could not load your saved file. Perhaps it was created with a different version of Blockly?
trans-unit.note: alert - There was a problem loading a file previously saved by the user. The most likely reason for the problem is that it was created with an earlier, incompatible version of Blockly. This message will be folllowed by technical information useful to engineers trying to understand the problem.

trans-unit.source: Make the farmer remove all the mounds, using as few blocks as possible.

trans-unit.note: verb - imperative or infinitive preceding one or more commands to a person.

trans-unit.source: Move the farmer along the field. If there is a mound, remove it, and if there is a hole, fill it in.

trans-unit.note: An abbreviation of the direction North

trans-unit.source: Could you use two while blocks to complete this level with fewer total blocks?
trans-unit.note: hint - A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over. The red marker is the goal to be reached in the maze.

trans-unit.source: There is a solution using only 3 blocks. Can you find it? Try using the while block.
trans-unit.note: hint - A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over. The red marker is the goal to be reached in the maze.

verb - imperative or infinitive for a person turning his head and body one quarter rotation counter-clockwise. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn right'. See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].

trans-unit.source: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do the first block of actions. Otherwise, do the second block of actions.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.

trans-unit.source: Share your blocks with this link:\n\n%1
trans-unit.note: alert - After the user has pressed a button to save his/her program, this provides the URL (%1) to retrieve the program. The characters '\n\n' indicate that a blank line will be displayed before the URL (in English). Leave those in unless you move %1 to the beginning or middle of the text, in which case you should use your judgment about where blank lines would be most useful.

trans-unit.source: Make the farmer fill in the hole. Check out the new option in the dropdown menu on the while block.
There was a problem with the request.
trans-unit.note: alert - The URL is invalid or a server error occurred. This message will be followed by technical information useful to engineers trying to understand the problem.

trans-unit.source: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
trans-unit.note: tracking is suggesting to the user that they should follow each instruction and follow how that will affect the movement. A 'program' is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.
Indicates the presence of at least one ball, as in 'he brought a ball, there are now balls present'

trans-unit.source: Move the farmer to the hole and fill it with two shovelfuls of dirt.

trans-unit.note: The project name. If readers of your language would know approximately how to pronounce 'Blockly', leave unchanged. Otherwise, include a transliteration in parentheses, such as the Russian: 'Blockly (Блoкли)'. This should be identical to {lb}{lb}msg-blockly|Maze-Apps.blocklyMessage{rb}{rb}.

warning - No more blocks may be added until some are removed. Do not alter the portions between pointy brackets (< and >), although you may move them within the phrase and replace 0 with one or more words.

trans-unit.source: Try using the given blocks to remove all the mounds on the ground.
Congratulations! You have solved the final level.
trans-unit.note: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the most difficult level.

trans-unit.source: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
trans-unit.note: tracking is suggesting to the user that they should follow each instruction and follow how that will affect the movement. A 'program' is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do next.

trans-unit.source: It's still dark outside. Tell the farmer to fill in all the holes. Each hole needs 5 shovelfuls of dirt.

trans-unit.note: condensed form of 'if there is a no path to the right', as in: 'if no path to the right, turn right'.
button - Closes the dialog and continues to the next level

trans-unit.source: Use the function, jump hurdle and remove 1, to help the farmer jump the row of hurdles.

trans-unit.note: condensed form of 'while something is true'
warning - Only %1 more blocks may be used, where %1 is an integer greater than 1. Do not alter the portions between pointy brackets (< and >), although you may move them within the phrase.

trans-unit.source: Can you use the while block to complete the level with only 4 blocks?
trans-unit.note: hint - A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over. The red marker is the goal to be reached in the maze.
verb - imperative or infinitive to repeat the following commands. The phrase is followed by the symbol denoting the end of the maze.
condensed form of 'if there is a path to the left', as in: 'if path to the left, turn left'.

trans-unit.source: Can you find a solution using 6 blocks? Try including 2 if blocks.
trans-unit.note: hint - A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over.

trans-unit.source: You are now given a new function block, fill 5, in the Functions category. It will fill 5 shovelfuls to a hole. Use it to make the farmer fill in the hole.

trans-unit.note: condensed form of 'if there is a path ahead', as in: 'if path ahead, go forward'.
conjunction - 'otherwise', introducing commands to be performed if a previous condition was not true, as in 'if x>3, do this, else do that'.
condensed form of 'if there is a no path ahead', as in: 'if no path ahead, go forward'.

trans-unit.source: Try defining your own function and use it.
trans-unit.note: hint - A 'repeat' block is used to repeat blocks over and over.
